content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers:
The target structure consists of two separate constructions:
1. Left structure: A red arch-like construction with yellow beams on top
   - 4 red blocks (2 arch blocks at the bottom and 2 rectangular blocks on top)
   - 3 yellow rectangular blocks placed horizontally on top
2. Right structure: An orange tower with yellow platforms
   - 3 orange cylindrical blocks (2 at the bottom as supports and 1 tall one in the middle)
   - 1 orange triangular block at the top of the tall cylinder
   - 2 yellow rectangular blocks positioned as crossing platforms

Total blocks: 13 blocks across both structures

## Spatial Relationships:
- Left structure: 
  - Two red arch blocks (#1 and #2) form the base
  - Two red rectangular blocks (#3) sit on top of the arches
  - Three yellow rectangular blocks (#4, #5, and another #4) rest on top of the red blocks
  
- Right structure:
  - Two orange cylindrical blocks (#9) form vertical supports at the bottom
  - One taller orange cylindrical block (#9) stands in the middle
  - An orange triangular block (#12) sits on top of the tall cylinder
  - Two yellow rectangular blocks (#7 and #8) are positioned horizontally as crossing platforms

# Selected Blocks from Dictionary

Based on the analysis, the following blocks are required:
- Block #1: Red arch block (used once)
- Block #2: Red arch block (used once)
- Block #3: Red rectangular block with vertical orientation (used twice)
- Block #4: Yellow long rectangular block with horizontal orientation (used twice)
- Block #5: Yellow rectangular block with horizontal orientation (used once)
- Block #7: Yellow rectangular block with horizontal orientation (used once)
- Block #8: Yellow rectangular block with horizontal orientation (used once)
- Block #9: Orange cylindrical block with vertical orientation (used three times)
- Block #12: Orange triangular block (used once)

# Assembly Order

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 1
   Step2: Move block with index 2
   Step3: Move block with index 3
   Step4: Move block with index 3
   Step5: Move block with index 4
   Step6: Move block with index 5
   Step7: Move block with index 4
   Step8: Move block with index 9
   Step9: Move block with index 9
   Step10: Move block with index 9
   Step11: Move block with index 12
   Step12: Move block with index 7
   Step13: Move block with index 8
}
```

This assembly order follows a bottom-to-top approach for each structure, starting with the left structure and then building the right structure.
